properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 2:27PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow Followed by Bitter Cold and Windy Conditions
Overnight into Thursday Morning...

.A winter storm system will continue to spread snow northward
across eastern Iowa and northwest Illinois late this afternoon.
The snow will be followed by a strong cold front, which will bring
bitter cold temperatures and strong winds tonight into Thursday.
Snowfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected across northeast
Missouri, portions of eastern Iowa and northwest Illinois. Strong
northwest will cause blowing and drifting snow and lead to wind
chill index readings as low as 15 below to 25 below zero late
tonight into Thursday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph
tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as
low as 20 below zero Thursday morning.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Missouri, southeast Iowa and
west central Illinois.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST
Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 AM to noon CST
Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

In Illinois, go to www.gettingaroundillinois.com for road
conditions.
In Iowa, call 511 for road conditions.
In Missouri, call 800-222-6400 for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON CST THURSDAY
